DOC.brief_summary: Effıcacy dinoprostone vaginal insert versus double- balloon catheter among woman induction labor
DOC.brief_title: Dinoprostone Vaginal Insert Versus Double Balloon Catheter Preinduction Cervical Ripening
DOC.detailed_description: The study conduct Department Obstetrics Gynecology Kanuni Sultan Süleyman Education Research Hospital , İstanbul , Turkey , approval local institutional review board . All participant give informed consent begin study . Women agree participate first stratify nulliparous multiparous group . Randomisation carry use seal opaque envelope piece paper inside marked 'PGE2 vaginal insert ' 'Double-balloon catheter ' . Envelopes prepare block 20 ( 10 PGE2 vaginal insert 10 double-balloon catheter ) stratify group . Envelopes shuffle place box mark 'nulliparous ' 'multiparous ' . The investigator blind allocation procedure . The allocated envelope open clinician perform initial vaginal examination prior examination . In group assign mechanical ripening , double- balloon catheter ( Cook Cervical Ripener Balloon , Cook OB/GYN , Spencer IN ) insert cervical canal direct visualisation sterile speculum examination . Once balloon enter cervical canal , first balloon fill 40 ml saline level internal o . The second ( vaginal ) balloon inflate 20 ml saline.Then fill 60 ml saline . The external end device tap without traction medial aspect woman 's thigh . After completion device placement , patient undergo continous fetal heart rate monitoring 30 min allow ambulate.The double ballon place 12 hour . In group randomly assign vaginal insert place high vaginal fornix , patient monitor least 1 hour fetal heart rate uterine activity allow ambulate . After 12 hour oxytocin isadministered use standard dose regimen patient . Primary secondary outcome measure .
DOC.criteria: Eligible woman obstetric medical indication labor induction intact membrane singleton pregnancy , vertex presentation low Bishop score ≤6 gestational age ≥34 w reassure fetal heart trace admission . Exclusion criterion placenta previa unexplained vaginal bleeding nonvertex presentation intrauterine fetal death prior cesarean delivery scar uterus contraindication vaginal delivery .
